text:
There is is french character with ascii value 138 (back tick/quote on top of 
the letter 'e'.  This back tick/quote is similar to single quote - available on 
the same key as tilda i.e. first key in the second row on the keyboard).  This 
character is not processed correctly while pdf is being rendered.  When I see 
the generated pdf file, this character appears as '#'.  A String similar 
to "1ch36962?" is displayed on the standard output, while the pdf is being 
rendered.
creator: kashyapsanjeev@yahoo.com

text:
Rendering any Unicode character is solved in the latest version by embedding the
font(s).

The string "ch36962?" means that the encoding given to the original XML file was
not correctly set.  By default it is "utf-8", thus combining the è with the next
letter...  Try setting <?xml version='1.0' encoding='iso-8859-1'?> in the file
header.
creator: Alain.FAGOT@framfab.nl

text: Fixed by the latest code by Tore Engvig and Alain Fagot
creator: fotis.jannidis@lrz.uni-muenchen.de
gadams@apache.org
text: batch transition pre-FOP1.0 resolved+fixed bugs to closed+fixed
